Killing a Bleeding enemy creates an explosion that inflicts 11% Bleeding damage over 5 seconds.

Gain {20/40/60/80/100/120/140/160/180/200} Thorns. Also gain 20 Thorns for each 25 bonus Maximum Life you have.
Movement Speed is increased by +{4/8/12/16/20/24/28/32/36/40}%.

You deal x{7.5/15/22.5/30/37.5/45/52.5/60/67.5/75}% increased damage against Injured enemies.

1HSword_Unique_Barb_100.desc: After generating 100.0 Fury your next Core Skill creates a Dust Devil that deals {100/180} damage to enemies behind the target.
1HSword_Unique_Barb_100.flavor:
"Without him the wine is less sweet, the hearth less warm, and our blades less keen. He deserved to see ten thousand more suns. Our blood-brother is gone, but Bul-Kathos willing, we will meet again one day."
- Sorrowsong for Ramaladni
1HSword_Unique_Barb_100.name: Ramaladni's Magnum Opus

2HAxe_Unique_Barb_001.desc: Steel Grasp launches 2 additional chains. Enemies hit by Steel Grasp are Slowed by {55/65}% for 3.0 seconds.
2HAxe_Unique_Barb_001.flavor:
"Weapons wielded by the fiercest warriors often catch the eye of the Ancient spirits. If the wielder is worthy, the spirits may bless the steel with their strength."
- Gerti, Oxen Tribe Forgemaster
2HAxe_Unique_Barb_001.name: Ancients' Oath

2HMace_Unique_Barb_001.desc: Upheaval ignites the ground Burning enemies for an additional {175/250} damage over 3.0 seconds.
2HMace_Unique_Barb_001.flavor: The demon prince Ikonoth slew hundreds of the Heavenly Host with this infernal hammer before falling to none other than the Archangel Imperius himself.
2HMace_Unique_Barb_001.name: Hellhammer

2HMace_Unique_Barb_100.desc: Death Blow creates a shockwave, dealing {16/30}% of its base damage to enemies. Enemies who die to this effect also reset Death Blow's Cooldown.
2HMace_Unique_Barb_100.flavor: The malformed snake creatures that reside in the swamps are not content with simply killing their prey. They seem to take a malicious pleasure from inflicting as much suffering as possible before death.
2HMace_Unique_Barb_100.name: Overkill

2HSword_Unique_Barb_002.desc: While using this weapon, damaging at least one enemy with Rupture creates a blood pool that inflicts {90/170} Bleeding damage over 6.0 seconds. Enemies standing in the pool take x10% increased Bleeding damage.
2HSword_Unique_Barb_002.flavor:
"We've been fighting these flesh-eaters for so long, been soaked in so much blood, that after a while it's difficult to tell what side you're truly on."
- Daelyr, Crane Tribe warrior
2HSword_Unique_Barb_002.name: Fields of Crimson

Boots_Unique_Barb_100.desc: After gaining the final damage bonus from Walking Arsenal, you automatically cast Ground Stomp and gain {32/50} Fury. This cannot happen more than once every 30 seconds.
Boots_Unique_Barb_100.flavor:
"While many Barbarians remained in the Dreadlands, small groups from the Oxen, Crane and Bear tribes instead chose to search the land for a new home."
- A History of the Children of Bul-Kathos
Boots_Unique_Barb_100.name: 100,000 Steps

Chest_Unique_Barb_002.desc: While Berserking, you deal {40/70} Fire damage every second to surrounding enemies.
Chest_Unique_Barb_002.flavor: The city of Harrogath, the final bastion of resistance against Baal's assault on Mt. Arreat, was reduced to rubble when the Worldstone was destroyed. The survivors never forgave the betrayal that led to the loss of their home.
Chest_Unique_Barb_002.name: Rage of Harrogath

Gloves_Unique_Barb_001.desc: Whirlwind explodes after it ends, dealing {50/70}% of the total base damage dealt to surrounding enemies as Fire damage.
Gloves_Unique_Barb_001.flavor:
"The brutish, almost simplistic construction of these gloves belies the strength they bestow. Gohr was clearly no craftsman, but it would be foolish to ignore the triumph of his work."
- Barrett's Book of Implements
Gloves_Unique_Barb_001.name: Gohr's Devastating Grips

Ring_Unique_Barb_001.desc: Each point of Fury you generate while at max Fury grants your next Core Skill x{2/4}% increased damage, up to x{60/120}%.
Ring_Unique_Barb_001.flavor:
"The change that overtook my brother in the heat of battle was terrifying. His eyes turned hard like diamonds, and the way he moved... it was like he was dancing to music only he could hear."
- Captain Davinus
Ring_Unique_Barb_001.name: Battle Trance

legendary_druid_002.desc: After killing an enemy with Shred, your next Werewolf Skill generates x{20/30}% more Spirit and deals x{20/30}% increased damage.
legendary_druid_002.name: of the Unsatiated

legendary_druid_005.desc: Gain 1 Spirit when you are struck as a Werebear.
legendary_druid_005.name: Mangled

legendary_druid_010.desc: Lucky Hit: Wind Shear has up to a {5/10}% chance to fully restore your Spirit.
legendary_druid_010.name: of the Calm Breeze

legendary_druid_012.desc: Gain Stealth for 2 seconds when killing enemies with Shred. Breaking Stealth with an attack grants Ambush which guarantees Critical Strikes for {1/2.5} seconds.

legendary_druid_013.desc: Hurricane damage is increased by x{7/15}% each second while active.
legendary_druid_013.name: of the Tempest

legendary_druid_018.desc: Damage from Earth skills Slow enemies hit by {25/50}% for 5.0 seconds.
legendary_druid_018.name: of Quicksand

legendary_druid_023.desc: Earth Skills deal x{40/50}% more Critical Strike damage to Crowd Controlled enemies.
legendary_druid_023.name: Crashstone

legendary_druid_026.desc: The duration of Earthen Bulwark is increased by 6 seconds. In addition, killing an enemy with Earth Skills replenishes {25/50} of your active Earthen Bulwark's barrier.
legendary_druid_026.name: of Mending Stone

legendary_druid_028.desc: Lucky Hit: Up to a {10/20}% chance when dealing Lightning damage to overload the target for 3.0 seconds, causing any direct damage you deal to them to pulse 350 additional damage to surrounding enemies.
legendary_druid_028.name: Overcharged

legendary_druid_029.desc:
Casting a Storm Skill grants your Earth Skills x{30/45}% Critical Strike Damage for 4.0 seconds.

Casting a Earth Skill increases the Critical Strike Chance of Storm Skills by {8/12}% for 4.0 seconds.
legendary_druid_029.name: of Natural Balance

legendary_druid_038.desc: Werebear Skills restore {1/2} Spirit when you hit enemies afflicted by your Poisons. When Spirit is restored, your Poison effects are removed from the enemy.
legendary_druid_038.name: of the Changeling's Debt

legendary_druid_042.desc: When you use a Shapeshifting Skill that changes your form, gain {25/50} Life. If you are at full Life, gain the same amount as Fortify.
legendary_druid_042.name: Skinwalker's

legendary_druid_047.desc: Earthspike launches spikes in a line and has a {1.5/2.5} second cooldown.
legendary_druid_047.name: Seismic-shift

legendary_druid_049.desc: Trample now summons Landslides during it's duration that deal {70/80}% normal damage. Trample is now also a Nature Magic and Earth Skill.
legendary_druid_049.name: of the Trampled Earth

legendary_druid_057.desc: Your Earth skills are now also Werebear skills and Fortify you for {1/2}.
legendary_druid_057.name: Stonefur

legendary_druid_058.desc:
Lucky Hit: Storm skills have up to a {15/25}% chance to grant 10.0 Spirit.

Your base Storm Skills are now also Werewolf Skills
legendary_druid_058.name: Storm Beast's

legendary_druid_059.desc: Critical strikes with Shred deal {30/45}% of the damage dealt as lightning to the target and surrounding enemies.
legendary_druid_059.name: Stormclaw's

legendary_druid_060.desc: Increase your maximum Spirit by {30/50} and Spirit Generation by x20% while Grizzly Rage is active.
legendary_druid_060.name: Balanced

legendary_druid_062.desc: Cyclone Armor also provides Physical Damage Reduction. In addition, Cyclone Armor will also be applied to all Nearby Allies.
legendary_druid_062.name: of Cyclonic Force

legendary_druid_063.desc: Landslide strikes an additional 3 times and deals an additional {6/12}% bonus damage per strike.
legendary_druid_063.name: of The Aftershock

legendary_druid_066.desc: Pulverize is now also an Earth skill. After casting Pulverize, tectonic spikes continue to deal {175/250} damage over 2.0 seconds.
legendary_druid_066.name: of the Ursine Horror

legendary_druid_071.desc: Your Core skills deal up to x{20/40}% increased damage based on your percent Fortified Health.
legendary_druid_071.name: of Retaliation

legendary_druid_074.desc: Pulverize creates a shockwave that travels forward, dealing {90/130}% of its damage to targets in the path.
legendary_druid_074.name: Shockwave

legendary_druid_075.desc: Your Wolf companions are now Werewolf companions. Werewolf companions deal +{75/100}% additional damage and can spread Rabies.
legendary_druid_075.name: of the Alpha

legendary_druid_077.desc: Blood Howl increases Critical Strike Chance by {5/10}%. In addition, Blood Howl also affects Nearby Companions and Players for 3.0 seconds.
legendary_druid_077.name: Nighthowler's

legendary_druid_078.desc: Werewolf Skills function as Storm Skills and Werebear Skills function as Earth Skills for the Nature's Fury passive.
legendary_druid_078.name: of Nature's Savagery

legendary_druid_080.desc: Core Skills deal an additional {6/8}% damage for each active Companion.
legendary_druid_080.name: Shepherd's

legendary_druid_100.desc: Gain {10/15}% Damage Reduction while Shapeshifted into a Werewolf.
legendary_druid_100.name: Vigorous

legendary_druid_102.desc: Debilitating Roar is now a Werewolf Skill. In addition, Debilitating Roar will Immobilize Poisoned enemies for {2/4} seconds.
legendary_druid_102.name: of the Dark Howl

legendary_druid_104.desc: The duration of Grizzly Rage is increased by {1/5} seconds. In addition, Critical Strikes while Grizzly Rage is active increase your Critical Strike Damage by 10% for the duration.
legendary_druid_104.name: of the Rampaging Werebeast

legendary_druid_106.desc: Your Companions gain the bonuses from Bestial Rampage.
legendary_druid_106.name: of the Wildrage

legendary_druid_108.desc: When you have Fortified Life your Earth Skills gain +3.
legendary_druid_108.name: Ballistic

legendary_druid_109.desc: While Hurricane is active, gain +3 to your Shapeshifting Skills.
legendary_druid_109.name: Stormshifter's

legendary_druid_110.desc: Tornado will seek up to {1/5} targets.
legendary_druid_110.name: Stormchaser's

legendary_druid_111.desc: Critical strikes with Storm Skills charge the air around you for {1/2} seconds causing a Lightning Strike to periodically hit an enemy in the area for 500 Lightning damage.
legendary_druid_111.name: Runeworker's Conduit

legendary_druid_112.desc: The Earthen Might talent also applies to your Storm skills.
legendary_druid_112.name: Mighty Storm's

legendary_druid_113.desc: When Nature's Fury triggers a free Skill, reduce your non-Ultimate Cooldowns of the opposite type by {4/8} seconds.
legendary_druid_113.name: Symbiotic

legendary_druid_114.desc: Gain {15/25}% bonus amount to your next Earthen Bulwark for each enemy you Crowd Control up to a maximum of 100.0%.
legendary_druid_114.name: Earthguard

ParagonGlyph_011.desc: For every 10 Intelligence purchased within range, you deal +{3.75/4.5/5.25/6/6.75/7.5/8.25/9/9.75/10.5/11.25/12/12.75/13.5/14.25/15/15.75/16.5/17.25/18/18.75}% increased damage while Healthy.

ParagonGlyph_012.bonus: You take 10% reduced damage while you have an active Barrier.

ParagonGlyph_016.bonus: When an enemy is damaged by you, they become Vulnerable for 3 seconds. This cannot happen more than once every 20 seconds per enemy.
ParagonGlyph_016.desc: For every 10 Dexterity purchased within range, you deal +{3/3.6/4.2/4.8/5.4/6/6.6/7.2/7.8/8.4/9/9.6/10.2/10.8/11.4/12/12.6/13.2/13.8/14.4/15}% increased damage to Vulnerable targets.
ParagonGlyph_016.name: Exploit

ParagonGlyph_034.bonus: You take up to 12% reduced damage the more Fortified you are.
ParagonGlyph_034.desc: For every 10 Intelligence purchased within range, you deal +{3/3.6/4.2/4.8/5.4/6/6.6/7.2/7.8/8.4/9/9.6/10.2/10.8/11.4/12/12.6/13.2/13.8/14.4/15}% increased damage while Fortified.
ParagonGlyph_034.name: Undaunted

ParagonGlyph_035.bonus: When you Overpower a target, all damage they take is increased by x12% for 30 seconds.
ParagonGlyph_035.desc: For every 10 Intelligence purchased within range, you deal +{9/10.8/12.6/14.4/16.2/18/19.8/21.6/23.4/25.2/27/28.8/30.6/32.4/34.2/36/37.8/39.6/41.4/43.2/45}% increased Overpower damage.
ParagonGlyph_035.name: Dominate

Active: Direct the wolves to focus an enemy, leaping to them and striking for {35/38.5/42/45.5/49/52.5/56/59.5/63/66.5}% damage.

Cooldown: 15 seconds
Lucky Hit Chance: 25% (per hit)
Passive: Powerful winds surround you, granting {20/21.8/23.5/25.2/26.8/28.4/30/31.6/33.1/34.6}% non-Physical damage reduction.

Active: The winds rapidly expand, Knocking Back enemies and dealing {15/16.5/18/19.5/21/22.5/24/25.5/27/28.5}% damage.

Cooldown: 25 seconds
Lucky Hit Chance: 33% (per use)
 fly above you and periodically attack your enemies for 13% damage every 5 seconds.
Active: The target area is swarmed with ravens, dealing {85/93.5/102/110.5/119/127.5/136/144.5/153/161.5}% damage over 6 seconds.
Shred's third combo attack is larger and applies a potent poison to enemies hit dealing an additional {51/56/61/66.5/71.5/76.5/81.5/86.5/92/97}% damage over 5 seconds.
Hurricane has a 15% chance to make enemies Vulnerable for 3 seconds.

Spirit Cost: 35
Lucky Hit Chance: 20% (per hit)
Shapeshift into a Werewolf and perform a 3-combo attack.

• 1st Attack: Dash towards the target and deal {25/27.5/30/32.5/35/37.5/40/42.5/45/47.5}% damage.
• 2nd Attack: Deal {35/38.5/42/45.5/49/52.5/56/59.5/63/66.5}% damage.
• 3rd Attack: Perform a larger finishing move dealing {60/66/72/78/84/90/96/102/108/114}% damage.

Druid_Passive_Deer_03.desc: Take x10% Reduced Damage from Elites.
Druid_Passive_Deer_03.name: Wariness

Druid_Passive_Deer_04.desc: Reduce the duration of incoming crowd control effects by x15%.
Druid_Passive_Deer_04.name: Advantageous Beast

Druid_Passive_Snake_01.desc: Lucky Hit: Earth skills have up to a 15% chance to Stun enemies for 3 seconds. If the target is already stunned and is not a boss, they Overpower the target instead.
Druid_Passive_Snake_01.name: Obsidian Slam

Druid_Passive_Snake_02.desc: Lucky Hit: Dealing Lightning damage has up to a 20% chance to cause the target to emit a static discharge, dealing 20% damage to surrounding enemies.
Druid_Passive_Snake_02.name: Overload

Druid_Passive_Snake_03.desc: Critical Strikes with Shapeshifting skills heal you for 3% of your maximum Life.
Druid_Passive_Snake_03.name: Masochistic

Druid_Passive_Snake_04.desc: Lucky Hit: Nature Magic skills have up to a 15% chance to reduce the cooldown of your Ultimate skill by 2 seconds.
Druid_Passive_Snake_04.name: Calm Before the Storm

Druid_Passive_Wolf_01.desc: Lucky Hit: Critical Strikes have up to a 20% chance to reset the cooldown of your Companion skills.
Druid_Passive_Wolf_01.name: Packleader

Druid_Passive_Wolf_02.desc: Lucky Hit: Dealing damage has up to a 15% chance to restore 10 Spirit.
Druid_Passive_Wolf_02.name: Energize

Druid_Passive_Wolf_03.desc: Fortify for 10% of your maximum Life when you use a Defensive skill.
Druid_Passive_Wolf_03.name: Bolster

Druid_Passive_Wolf_04.desc: Extend the duration of Ultimate skills by 25%.
Druid_Passive_Wolf_04.name: Calamity

1HAxe_Unique_Druid_001.desc: Grizzly Rage now shapeshifts you into a Dire Werewolf. Dire Werewolf gains {15/25}% movement speed instead of damage reduction and a {30/50}% Spirit cost reduction bonus. In addition, kills heal you for 10.0% of your maximum Life.
1HAxe_Unique_Druid_001.flavor: The nights preceding the full moon are sometimes far more dangerous than the event itself. The anticipation of the upcoming event can drive some werewolves into a fever from which they never recover.
1HAxe_Unique_Druid_001.name: Waxing Gibbous

1HMace_Unique_Druid_001.desc: Lightning Storm Critical Strikes spawn 3.0 Dancing Bolts that seek enemies in the area dealing {250/300} Lightning damage.
1HMace_Unique_Druid_001.flavor:
"Listen, child, to the music of the storm. It has its own rhythm. Its own melody. Hear how beautifully it sings, and perhaps one day you will be able to join in its harmony." 
– Airidah
1HMace_Unique_Druid_001.name: Tempest Song

2HStaff_Unique_Druid_001.desc: Claw is now a Storm skill and also casts Storm Strike at {120/150}% normal damage.
2HStaff_Unique_Druid_001.flavor:
"She has existed in Scosglen since before Fiacla-Géar walked the land. Her purpose is a mystery, and she remains impartial in all conflicts. Approach her with deference, and she may grant you her counsel."
- Airidah, to Donan
2HStaff_Unique_Druid_001.name: Greatstaff of the Crone

Chest_Unique_Druid_002.desc: Werewolf form is now your true form, and you gain +2 to all Werewolf skills.
Chest_Unique_Druid_002.flavor:
"He was not a victim of the curse - he sought it out. As his skin split and his bones cracked, his laughter never ceased." 
– Tale of the Mad Nobleman
Chest_Unique_Druid_002.name: Mad Wolf's Glee

Chest_Unique_Druid_003.desc: Werebear form is now your true form, and you gain +2 to all Werebear skills.
Chest_Unique_Druid_003.flavor: When the Days of Ash fell upon Scosglen, the great druid Nafain reminded his disciples that nothing, not even the loss of their humanity, was too great a sacrifice to protect Túr Dúlra from Astaroth's flames.
Chest_Unique_Druid_003.name: Insatiable Fury

Pants_Unique_Druid_001.desc: Your Wolf Companions are infused with the power of the storm, dealing Lightning damage and gaining the Storm Howl ability.
Pants_Unique_Druid_001.flavor:
"The storm's rage is my own, brother. I call, and the skies roar in reply."
- Vasily, to Bul-Kathos
Pants_Unique_Druid_001.name: Storm's Companion

Ring_Unique_Druid_001.desc: Gain 1 additional companion. In addition, your Companion Skills deal {100/150}% bonus damage.
Ring_Unique_Druid_001.flavor:
"A sapling from the Great Oak, left to grow at the seaward statue of the Druid's Patriarch, will on rare occasions be found twisted back upon itself, suffused with natural magic."
- Barrett's Book of Implements
Ring_Unique_Druid_001.name: Vasily's Prayer

Ring_Unique_Druid_003.desc:
Gain a bonus when you kill with a Shapeshifting Skill:

• Werewolf: Your next non-ultimate Werebear Skill costs no resource and has no cooldown.
• Werebear: Your next Werewolf skill will heal you for {50/100} when damage is first dealt.
Ring_Unique_Druid_003.flavor:
"By fang, claw, spear, or sword - send the bastards back to the flames from which they crawled! Soak the peat with their blood! For Fiacla-Géar! For Scosglen!"
- Nafain, during the Days of Ash
Ring_Unique_Druid_003.name: Hunter's Zenith

Dungeon Affix.Berserking: Monsters become strong the longer they stay in combat.
Dungeon Affix.Blizzard: Random blizzard storms that move around.
Dungeon Affix.Cold Enhanced: Monster hits have 30% chance to chill targets.
Dungeon Affix.Destabilizing: Enemy hit has a chance to teleport you randomly.
Dungeon Affix.Empowered Elites (Waller): More elites spawn in this dungeon, Elites always have "Waller" affix.
Dungeon Affix.Fire Enhanced: Monster hits have 30% chance to burn targets.
Dungeon Affix.Lightning Enhanced: Monster hits call down thunder upon you and slow you heavily. You recover from the slow overtime.
Dungeon Affix.Major_Avenger: Killing a monster enrages monsters near it, making them dealing more damage.
Dungeon Affix.Major_Blood Blister: Monster death will sometimes spawn a Blood Blister. After a short time, it explodes, dealing heavy area damage.
Dungeon Affix.Major_DeathPulse: When a monster gets killed, it releases a deadly lightning pulse after a short delay.
Dungeon Affix.Major_Drifting Shade: Drifting shades chase their targets.  They explode for heavy damage upon reaching their target, creating nightmare fields that Daze victims.
Dungeon Affix.Major_Lightning Pulse: Stormbane's Wrath chases players around, releasing deadly pulses when reaching a player.
Dungeon Affix.Major_Lightning Storm: Lightning gathers above the player. Get into the protection dome to avoid severe outcomes.
Dungeon Affix.Major_Nightmare Portal: While in combat, nightmare portals open randomly near players, pouring out dangerous monsters.
Dungeon Affix.Major_Volcanic: While in combat, enemies periodically cause gouts of flame to erupt beneath the feet of players.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_AntiCC_Legendary: Monster Crowd Controlled duration is reduced by 40%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_AntiCC_Magic: Monster Crowd Controlled duration is reduced by 20%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_AntiCC_Rare: Monster Crowd Controlled duration is reduced by 30%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_AntiCrit_Legendary: Monsters take 60% less Critical Strike damage.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_AntiCrit_Magic: Monsters take 30% less Critical Strike damage.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_AntiCrit_Rare: Monsters take 45% less Critical Strike damage.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_AttackBehind_Legendary: Monsters near the player deal 200% more damage striking from behind.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_AttackBehind_Magic: Monsters near the player deal 100% more damage striking from behind.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_AttackBehind_Rare: Monsters near the player deal 150% more damage striking from behind.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_BarrierKiller_Legendary: Monsters deal 100% more damage to Barriers.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_BarrierKiller_Magic: Monsters deal 50% more damage to Barriers.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_BarrierKiller_Rare: Monsters deal 75% more damage to Barriers.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_Barrier_Legendary: Monsters gain 30% Maximum Life as Barrier.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_Barrier_Magic: Monsters gain 20% Maximum Life as Barrier.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_Barrier_Rare: Monsters gain 25% Maximum Life as Barrier.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ChanceSlow_Legendary: Monster attacks from a distance have 50% chance to slow targets.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ChanceSlow_Magic: Monster attacks from a distance have 30% chance to slow targets.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ChanceSlow_Rare: Monster attacks from a distance have 40% chance to slow targets.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_DrainResource_Legendary: Monster attacks from a distnace burn 16% of your Primary Resource.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_DrainResource_Magic: Monster attacks from a distance burn 8% of your Primary Resource.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_DrainResource_Rare: Monster attacks from a distance burn 12% of your Primary Resource.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraBleeding_Legendary: Monsters deal an additional 30% of their Physical damage dealt as Bleeding over 5 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraBleeding_Magic: Monsters deal an additional 15% of their Physical damage dealt as Bleeding over 5 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraBleeding_Rare: Monsters deal an additional 22% of their Physical damage dealt as Bleeding over 5 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraBurning_Legendary: Monsters deal an additional 30% of their Physical damage dealt as Burning over 5 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraBurning_Magic: Monsters deal an additional 15% of their Physical damage dealt as Burning over 5 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraBurning_Rare: Monsters deal an additional 22% of their Physical damage dealt as Burning over 5 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraCold_Legendary: Monsters deal an additional 20% of their Physical damage dealt as Cold.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraCold_Magic: Monsters deal an additional 10% of their Physical damage dealt as Cold.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraCold_Rare: Monsters deal an additional 15% of their Physical damage dealt as Cold.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraCorruption_Legendary: Monsters deal an additional 30% of their Physical damage dealt as Shadow over 5 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraCorruption_Magic: Monsters deal an additional 15% of their Physical damage dealt as Shadow over 5 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraCorruption_Rare: Monsters deal an additional 22% of their Physical damage dealt as Shadow over 5 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraFire_Legendary: Monsters deal an additional 20% of their Physical damage dealt as Fire.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraFire_Magic: Monsters deal an additional 10% of their Physical damage dealt as Fire.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraFire_Rare: Monsters deal an additional 15% of their Physical damage dealt as Fire.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraLightning_Legendary: Monsters deal an additional 20% of their Physical damage dealt as Lightning.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraLightning_Magic: Monsters deal an additional 10% of their Physical damage dealt as Lightning.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraLightning_Rare: Monsters deal an additional 15% of their Physical damage dealt as Lightning.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraPoison_Legendary: Monsters deal an additional 30% of their Physical damage dealt as Poison over 5 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraPoison_Magic: Monsters deal an additional 15% of their Physical damage dealt as Poison over 5 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraPoison_Rare: Monsters deal an additional 22% of their Physical damage dealt as Poison over 5 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraShadow_Legendary: Monsters deal an additional 20% of their Physical damage dealt as Shadow.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraShadow_Magic: Monsters deal an additional 10% of their Physical damage dealt as Shadow.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ExtraShadow_Rare: Monsters deal an additional 15% of their Physical damage dealt as Shadow.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_HPRegen_Legendary: Non-boss monsters regen 1.5% Maximum Life per second.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_HPRegen_Magic: Non-boss monsters regen 1.5% Maximum Life per second.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_HPRegen_Rare: Non-boss monsters regen 1.5% Maximum Life per second.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_LessMelee_Legendary: Monsters take 40% less damage from close targets.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_LessMelee_Magic: Monsters take 20% less damage from close targets.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_LessMelee_Rare: Monsters take 30% less damage from close targets.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_LessRanged_Legendary: Monsters take 60% less damage from distant targets.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_LessRanged_Magic: Monsters take 30% less damage from distant targets.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_LessRanged_Rare: Monsters take 45% less damage from distant targets.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ReduceDodge_Legendary: Monster attacks from a distance reduce dodge chance by 12% for 6 seconds, stacking up to 60%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ReduceDodge_Magic: Monster attacks from a distance reduce dodge chance by 8% for 6 seconds, stacking up to 40%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ReduceDodge_Rare: Monster attacks from a distance reduce dodge chance by 10% for 6 seconds, stacking up to 50%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ReduceHealing_Legendary: Monster attacks from a distance have 30% chance to disable healing potion for 2 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ReduceHealing_Magic: Monster attacks from a distance have 20% chance to disable healing potion for 2 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ReduceHealing_Rare: Monster attacks from a distance have 25% chance to disable healing potion for 2 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ReduceResistance_Legendary: Monster attacks from a distance reduce resistance by 10% for 6 seconds, stacking up to 50%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ReduceResistance_Magic: Monster attacks from a distance reduce resistance by 6% for 6 seconds, stacking up to 30%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_ReduceResistance_Rare: Monster attacks from a distance reduce resistance by 8% for 6 seconds, stacking up to 40%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_SunderArmor_Legendary: Monster attacks from a distance reduce your armor by 7% for 6 seconds, stacking up to 35%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_SunderArmor_Magic: Monster attacks from a distance reduce your armor by 5% for 6 seconds, stacking up to 25%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_SunderArmor_Rare: Monster attacks from a distance reduce your armor by 6% for 6 seconds, stacking up to 30%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_Unstoppable_Legendary: Monsters become Unstoppable when life drops below 30%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_Unstoppable_Magic: Monsters become Unstoppable when life drops below 15%.
Dungeon Affix.Minor_Monster_Unstoppable_Rare: Monsters become Unstoppable when life drops below 22%.
Dungeon Affix.NewLabel: Monster attacks from a distance burn 5% of your Primary Resource.
Dungeon Affix.Physical Enhanced: Monster hits tear your muscles. Movement will bleed you out.
Dungeon Affix.Poison Enhanced: Monster hits have 30% chance to poison targets.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_AttackMoveSpeedOnKill_Legendary: Killing a monster grants 2.0% Attack and Move Speed. Stacking up to 20%.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_AttackMoveSpeedOnKill_Magic: Killing a monster grants 1.0% Attack and Move Speed. Stacking up to 10%.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_AttackMoveSpeedOnKill_Rare: Killing a monster grants 1.5% Attack and Move Speed. Stacking up to 15%.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_CCReduction_Legendary: The duration of CC's against you are reduced by 9%.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_CCReduction_Magic: The duration of CC's against you are reduced by 3%.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_CCReduction_Rare: The duration of CC's against you are reduced by 6%.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_CooldownReductionOnKill_Legenda: Kiliing a monster reduces your cooldowns by .1 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_CooldownReductionOnKill_Magic: Kiliing a monster reduces your cooldowns by .06 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_CooldownReductionOnKill_Rare: Kiliing a monster reduces your cooldowns by .08 seconds.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_DamageReductionForMissingHealth: Gain 6% damage reduction for every 10% Health you are missing.
Gain 4% damage reduction for every 10% Health you are missing.
Gain 5% damage reduction for every 10% Health you are missing.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_EvadeLeavesPoison: Using Evade leaves a pool of Poison behind that damages enemies.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_IncreasedCritChance_Legendary: Your Critical Strike chance is increased by 9%.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_IncreasedCritChance_Magic: Your Critical Strike chance is increased by 3%.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_IncreasedCritChance_Rare: Your Critical Strike chance is increased by 6%.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_IncreasedHealing_Legendary: Your Healing Received is increased by 15%.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_IncreasedHealing_Magic: Your Healing Received is increased by 5%.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_IncreasedHealing_Rare: Your Healing Received is increased by 10%.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_MagicFind: You find more items from enemies.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_PeriodicLightning: You occasionally call down lightning strikes that damage nearby enemies.
Dungeon Affix.Positive_StunCausesBurning: Being hit by Crowd Control effects creates an explosion around you.
Dungeon Affix.Proximity Shield: Random monsters gain proximity shield, preventing any damages from outside the shield.
Dungeon Affix.Resource Drain: You no longer passively generate or lost resource. Your resource drains while moving, and gains while standing still.
Dungeon Affix.Trial_AbyssalGrowths: Destroy 10 Abyssal Growths before they hatch to earn a special reward.
Dungeon Affix.Trial_DemonicIdol: Keep the Demonic Idol intact to earn a special reward.
Dungeon Affix.Trial_EventMastery: Complete the Mastery of 2 Dungeon Events to earn a special reward.
Dungeon Affix.Trial_NoWipe: Complete the Dungeon Objective without the Party wiping to earn a special reward.
Dungeon Affix.Trial_ProtectNPC: Keep the Cursed Wanderer alive until the Objective is Complete to earn a special reward.
Dungeon Affix.Trial_TimedRun: Complete the Dungeon Objective in 10 minutes to earn a special reward.
Dungeon Affix.Trial_UniqueSentries: Find and slay 5 Unique Sentries before they escape to earn a special reward.
Dungeon Affix.Wild Regeneration: Monsters aggressively regenerate health while moving.

Armor Contribution:
Armor Contribution: {#}
• The inherent percentage that Armor contributes to your base damage reduction against elemental attacks.
• The remaining damage reduction is determined by your appropriate elemental resistances.
• Differs in PvP.
Glossary.Barrier Bonus:
Barrier Bonus: {#}
• Increases the Barrier generated from your Barrier effects.
Glossary.Bludgeoning Weapon Damage:
Bludgeoning Attack: ({#} - {#})
• The base damage of your Two-Handed Bludgeoning Weapon.
• Skills wielding this weapon scale their base damage using this value.
• Equal to the weapon's base attack value.
Glossary.Class Damage Reduction:
Class Damage Reduction: {#}
• Inherent damage reduction granted by your class against monsters.
Glossary.Close Crit Bonus:
Close Crit Bonus: {#}
• Increases Critical Strike Chance against enemies close to you.
Glossary.Cold Resistance:
Cold Resistance: {#}
• Reduces incoming Cold damage by {#}.
• Makes up 50% of your initial damage reduction from Cold, with the remainder contributed by Armor.
• As this stat increases, additional bonuses become less effective.
Glossary.Control Impaired Duration Reduction:
Control Impaired Duration Reduction: {#}
• Reduces the duration of incoming Control Impairing Effects, including Stun, Slow, Immobilize, Freeze, and Daze.
Glossary.Cooldown Reduction:
Cooldown Reduction: {#}
• Reduces cooldown of all active skills.
Glossary.Critical Strike Chance:
Critical Strike Chance: {#}
• Critical strikes deal {#} bonus damage.
Glossary.Critical Strike Damage:
Critical Strike Damage Bonus: {#}
• Extra damage granted to your Critical Strikes.
• Has a base value of {#}.
• Capped at {#} against other players.
Damage Reduction:
PvP Damage Reduction: {#}
• Inherent damage reduction granted against other players in PvP.
Glossary.Dexterity:
Dexterity: {#} (Item Contribution: {#}){DEX_BENEFIT}
• Improves Chance to Dodge attacks by {#}
Glossary.Distant Crit Bonus:
Distant Crit Bonus: {#}
• Increases Critical Strike Chance against enemies far from you.
Glossary.Dodge Chance:
Dodge Chance: {#}
• The chance to dodge incoming attacks.
• Dodged attacks do no damage.
• As this stat increases, additional bonuses become less effective.
Glossary.Dual Wielded Weapon Damage:
Dual Wielded Weapon Damage: ({#} - {#})
• The base damage of your dual wielded One-Handed Weapons.
• Skills wielding these weapons scale their base damage using this value.
• Equal to the sum of the weapons' base attack values.
Glossary.Fire Resistance:
Fire Resistance: {#}
• Reduces incoming Fire damage by {#}.
• Makes up 50% of your initial damage reduction from Fire, with the remainder contributed by Armor.
• As this stat increases, additional bonuses become less effective.
Glossary.Fortify Bonus:
Fortify Bonus: {#}
• Increases the Fortified Life generated from your Fortify effects.
Glossary.Healing Bonus:
Healing Bonus: {#}
• Increases healing received from all sources.
Glossary.Intelligence:
Intelligence: {#} (Item Contribution: {#}){INT_BENEFIT}
• Increases All Resistances by {#}
Glossary.Life On Kill:
Life On Kill: {#}
• You will recover {#} Life for every enemy you kill.
Glossary.Lightning Resistance:
Lightning Resistance: {#}
• Reduces incoming Lightning damage by {#}.
• Makes up 50% of your initial damage reduction from Lightning, with the remainder contributed by Armor.
• As this stat increases, additional bonuses become less effective.
Glossary.Lucky Hit Chance Bonus:
Lucky Hit Chance Bonus: {#}
• Increases the chance of triggering Lucky Hits with your skills.
Glossary.Lucky Hit Execute:
Lucky Hit Execute: {#}
• You have a base {#} chance to instantly kill injured enemies on hit. 
• This probability scales with the skill used and your Lucky Hit Chance Bonus.
• Cannot activate against Champions, Elites, Bosses, or Players.
Glossary.Maximum Life Bonus:
Maximum Life Bonus: {#}
• Your overall Life is increased by {#}.
Glossary.Maximum {PRIMARY_RESOURCE}:
Maximum {PRIMARY_RESOURCE}: {#}
• Used to cast various skills.
Glossary.Minion Attack Speed Bonus:
Minion Attack Speed Bonus: {#}
• Increases the Attack Speed of your summoned Minions.
Glossary.Minion Life Bonus:
Minion Life Bonus: {#}
• Increases the Life of your summoned Minions.
Glossary.Movement Speed:
Movement Speed: {#}
• You run at {#} of base Movement Speed.
• You may have a maximum of 125.0% Movement Speed as a basic stat. 
• Temporary buffs may exceed this limit.
Glossary.Overpower Chance:
Overpower Chance: {#}
• Overpower deals bonus damage based on the sum of your current health and fortified health.
• Damage over time, passive abilities, and channeled abilities cannot Overpower.
• Cannot increase as a basic stat, but can be manipulated by certain skills.
Glossary.Passive Life Regeneration:
Passive Life Regeneration: {#}
• You will recover {#} Life per second outside of combat.
Glossary.Poison Resistance:
Poison Resistance: {#}
• Reduces incoming Poison damage by {#}.
• Makes up 50% of your initial damage reduction from Poison, with the remainder contributed by Armor.
• As this stat increases, additional bonuses become less effective.
Glossary.Potion Healing Bonus:
Potion Healing Bonus: {#}
• Increases healing received from potions.
Glossary.Ranged Weapon Damage:
Ranged Damage: ({#} - {#})
• The base damage of your Two-Handed Ranged Weapon.
• Skills wielding this weapon scale their base damage using this value.
• Equal to the weapon's base attack value.
Glossary.Shadow Resistance:
Shadow Resistance: {#}
• Reduces incoming Shadow damage by {#}.
• Makes up 50% of your initial damage reduction from Shadow, with the remainder contributed by Armor.
• As this stat increases, additional bonuses become less effective.
Glossary.Shrine Duration Bonus:
Shrine Duration Bonus: {#}
• Increases the duration of Shrine buffs.
Glossary.Slashing Weapon Damage:
Slashing Weapon Damage: ({#} - {#})
• The base damage of your Two-Handed Slashing Weapon.
• Skills wielding this weapon scale their base damage using this value.
• Equal to the weapon's base attack value.
Glossary.Vulnerable Damage:
Vulnerable Damage Bonus: {#}
• Extra damage granted against Vulnerable enemies.
• Has a base value of {#}.
• You have +{#} of this stat from items and Paragon.
Glossary.Weapon Damage:
Weapon Damage: ({#} - {#})
• The base damage of your equipped weapon(s).
• Skills scale their base damage using this value.
• If wielding one-handed weapons, this is the sum of their base attack values.
• If wielding a two-handed weapon, this is its base attack value.
Glossary.Weapon Speed:
Weapon Speed: {#} Attacks per Second
• This is the base attack speed inherent to your weapon before applying bonuses.
• If wielding one-handed weapons, their weapon speeds are averaged.
Glossary.{PRIMARY_RESOURCE} Cost Reduction:
{PRIMARY_RESOURCE} Cost Reduction: {#}
• Reduces the {PRIMARY_RESOURCE} cost of skills that consume resource.

1HDagger_QST_Frac_UnFlesh.flavor: Dried Blood has coalesced into jagged crystals surrounding the blade. This phenomenon must have occurred after dislodging the blade from Fedeor's chest.
1HDagger_QST_Frac_UnFlesh.name: Blood-Barbed Blade

1HDagger_QST_Kehj_Oasis_Armor_01.desc: (PH) Fashioned into the shape of a wolf's fang, this blade excels at striking from the shadows.
1HDagger_QST_Kehj_Oasis_Armor_01.name: (PH) Asa's Fanged Blade

1HDagger_Rare_QST_Class_Rogue_BakirasSti.flavor: [PH] This sharp needle like dagger was forged to weave paralyzing poison into the grain of the steel. Many of Bakira's victims will have felt the sting then nothing else before they died.
1HDagger_Rare_QST_Class_Rogue_BakirasSti.name: [PH] Bakira's Sting

1HDagger_Rare_QST_Hawe_Marsh_05.flavor: Mohlon, the largest and most cunning of the Nangari, is said to have gained her intelligence from consuming the witch Zala, who once called the Scrying Pools her home.
1HDagger_Rare_QST_Hawe_Marsh_05.name: Mohlon's Fang

1HDagger_Rare_QST_Scos_Moors_04.flavor: (PH) The tip of the spear used to kill Nafain, fashioned into a crude dagger, his corrupted blood still still stains its edge.
1HDagger_Rare_QST_Scos_Moors_04.name: (PH) Quietus of Nafain

1HSword_Rare_QST_Hawe_ByThreeTheyCome.flavor: "By the blood of the willing, we call her home."
1HSword_Rare_QST_Hawe_ByThreeTheyCome.name: One-Eyed Swordsman's Blade

1HWand_Rare_QST_Hawe_Verge_03.flavor: [PH] This wand is constructed out of scorched bone. The bone is surprisingly resilient and shows signs of heat discoloration.
1HWand_Rare_QST_Hawe_Verge_03.name: [PH] Hex-Flame

2HMaul_QST_Step_TheGreatMaul.flavor: Famed ancestral weapon of the Oxen Tribe stained with the blood of demons from the battle of Mt. Arreat.
2HMaul_QST_Step_TheGreatMaul.name: The Great Maul

2HStaff_QST_Scos_DeepForest_LeftinAshes.flavor: Carved with intricate runes and sanded perfectly smooth. Tender care was put into the crafting of this staff.
2HStaff_QST_Scos_DeepForest_LeftinAshes.name: Spirit of Éadaoin

2HStaff_Rare_QST_Hawe_Verge_03.flavor: [PH] This staff once belonged to Valtha, the Flame Touched. Much like the place she lived, the embers in the staff refuse to die out.
2HStaff_Rare_QST_Hawe_Verge_03.name: [PH] Ember Staff

2HSword_Rare_QST_Scos_BearOfBlackweald.flavor: [PH] A large two handed, once owned by Torben the 'Bear of Blackweald'. Many victims have met their demise on this ferocious blade. Its hardened edge charred and notched, no doubt born from the countless tales of brutality in which it has played the lead role.
2HSword_Rare_QST_Scos_BearOfBlackweald.name: [PH] The Bear's Claw

Amulet_Magic_Prologue.flavor: A too-tight choker worn by those faithful to the Cathedral of Light. Slight discomfort keeps one girded against impurity.
Amulet_Magic_Prologue.name: Choker of Penance

Amulet_Magic_QST_Scos_LochRaeth_Messagei.flavor: An antique amulet which was sealed in a bottle and swept out to sea. Its well-worn surface bears a faint family crest and the remaining flecks of an indecipherable inscription.
Amulet_Magic_QST_Scos_LochRaeth_Messagei.name: Druidic Heirloom Amulet

CMP_Hawe_CrusadersMont_Skull.desc: The rotted skull of a Zakarum Crusader
CMP_Hawe_CrusadersMont_Skull.name: Exhumed Crusader's Skull

CMP_Hawe_ErimansPyre_Key.desc: The ashes of the former inhabitants of Eriman's village
CMP_Hawe_ErimansPyre_Key.name: Villagers' Remains

CMP_Karamat_Quest_Item_Key1.desc: PHA magical crest that appears like it part of a greater whole
CMP_Karamat_Quest_Item_Key1.name: [PH] Karamat Key Fragment

CMP_Karamat_Quest_Item_Key2.desc: PHA magical crest that appears like it part of a greater whole
CMP_Karamat_Quest_Item_Key2.name: [PH] Karamat Key 2

CMP_Karamat_Quest_Item_Key3.desc: PHA magical crest that appears like it part of a greater whole
CMP_Karamat_Quest_Item_Key3.name: [PH] Karamat Key 3

CraftingMaterial_Herb_Common.desc: An herb used in the crafting of potions, elixirs & incense. Can appear nearly everywhere.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_Common.flavor: Considered foundational to the study of alchemy, Gallowvine serves to bond and enhance other elixirs.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_Common.name: Gallowvine

CraftingMaterial_Herb_Drysteppes.desc: A fungus used in the crafting of potions, elixirs & incense. Found in Dry Steppes.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_Drysteppes.flavor: A curiosity among fungi, coveted by alchemists for its stimulating and energizing properties.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_Drysteppes.name: Reddamine

CraftingMaterial_Herb_FracturedPeaks.desc: An herb used in the crafting of potions, elixirs & incense. Found in Fractured Peaks.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_FracturedPeaks.flavor: A hard, bitter berry prized by alchemists for its use as both an enduring raisin and its vital and defensive qualities.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_FracturedPeaks.name: Biteberry

CraftingMaterial_Herb_Hawezar.desc: An herb used in the crafting of potions, elixirs & incense. Found in Hawezar.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_Hawezar.flavor: A toxic swamp lily, prized by alchemists for its foul and aggressive qualities.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_Hawezar.name: Blightshade

CraftingMaterial_Herb_Kehjistan.desc: An herb used in the crafting of potions, elixirs & incense. Found in Kehjistan.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_Kehjistan.flavor: A native Kehjistani berry with an eerie face, prized by alchemists for its potent toxins and soporific effects.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_Kehjistan.name: Lifesbane

CraftingMaterial_Herb_Rare.desc: A rare herb used in the crafting of elixirs. Can appear nearly everywhere.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_Rare.flavor: A precious and rare strain of lily-of-the-valley. Considered an alchemical catalyst of few peers.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_Rare.name: Angelbreath

CraftingMaterial_Herb_Scosglen.desc: An herb used in the crafting of potions, elixirs & incense. Found in Scosglen.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_Scosglen.flavor: A hoary moss with a pungent, musky aroma, prized by alchemists for its vital and physical qualities.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_Scosglen.name: Howler Moss

CraftingMaterial_Herb_SuperRare.desc: An exceptionally hard to find herb. Found during the Helltide, when Sanctuary gives way to Hell's influence.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_SuperRare.flavor: Only mostly toxic in spite of its beauty, but still regarded a peerless catalyst by alchemists.
CraftingMaterial_Herb_SuperRare.name: Fiend Rose

CraftingMaterial_Leather_Common.desc: Common leather used for improving armor. Can be obtained from the various wildlife and beasts.
CraftingMaterial_Leather_Common.flavor: Coarse, rugged leather used for garments, tools, and toys for the hounds of Sanctuary.
CraftingMaterial_Leather_Common.name: Rawhide

CraftingMaterial_Leather_Rare.desc: Rare leather used for improving armor. Can be obtained from the various wildlife and beasts.
CraftingMaterial_Leather_Rare.flavor: Supple, rugged leather used for fine garments and even finer armor.
CraftingMaterial_Leather_Rare.name: Superior Leather

CraftingMaterial_MonsterDrop_Demon_Heart.desc: Found in the bodies of demons.
CraftingMaterial_MonsterDrop_Demon_Heart.flavor: Each Demon still carries a withered, beating heart that propels it forward. Rarely they are left in fine enough condition after the Demon is slain to use for other means.
CraftingMaterial_MonsterDrop_Demon_Heart.name: Demon's Heart

CraftingMaterial_MonsterDrop_Human_Tongu.desc: Found in the mouths of evil humans.
CraftingMaterial_MonsterDrop_Human_Tongu.flavor: The lies spouted by particularly black-hearted humans rarely manifest in turning their tongues a milky white.
CraftingMaterial_MonsterDrop_Human_Tongu.name: Paletongue

CraftingMaterial_MonsterDrop_Undead_Dust.desc: Found in the bodies, bones, or cerements of the undead.
CraftingMaterial_MonsterDrop_Undead_Dust.flavor: Long exposure to the walking dead imbues this dust with their inverse vitality, used in necromantic alchemies.
CraftingMaterial_MonsterDrop_Undead_Dust.name: Grave Dust

CraftingMaterial_MonsterDrop_Wildlife_Bo.desc: Found by killing beasts and animals, as well as werecreatures.
CraftingMaterial_MonsterDrop_Wildlife_Bo.flavor: Within the bones of wild creatures dwells a raw potency used by alchemists to enhance physical properties.
CraftingMaterial_MonsterDrop_Wildlife_Bo.name: Crushed Beast Bones

CraftingMaterial_Ore_Common.desc: Metal used for improving weapons and jewelry. Found in veins nearly everywhere.
CraftingMaterial_Ore_Common.flavor: A common, dark ore that while heavy results in clean, useful metal and used by artisans throughout Sanctuary.
CraftingMaterial_Ore_Common.name: Iron Chunk

CraftingMaterial_Ore_Rare.desc: Rare metal used for improving weapons and jewelry. Found in veins nearly everywhere.
CraftingMaterial_Ore_Rare.flavor: Silver is prized by artisans for both its beauty and potency against dangerous creatures throughout Sanctuary.
CraftingMaterial_Ore_Rare.name: Silver Ore

CraftingMaterial_Rare_ScatteredPrism.desc: A mysterious prism most often found in very, very large bodies, such as world bosses.
CraftingMaterial_Rare_ScatteredPrism.flavor: Rare and hoarded by their previous owners, these prisms are often guarded jealously.
CraftingMaterial_Rare_ScatteredPrism.name: Scattered Prism

CraftingMaterial_Salvage_Nightmare_Sigil.desc: Obtained by using the Occultist to salvage nightmare sigils of any tier.
CraftingMaterial_Salvage_Nightmare_Sigil.flavor: A mysterious powder that can be compressed into relics inviting peril for greater challenges and rewards.
CraftingMaterial_Salvage_Nightmare_Sigil.name: Sigil Powder

CraftingMaterial_Salvage_Rare.desc: Salvaged from rare weapons and armor, and used to alter the latent magic of things.
CraftingMaterial_Salvage_Rare.flavor: Occultists and enchanters commonly use these crystals to reorient or redirect magical energy. The process renders them inert, so many are needed.
CraftingMaterial_Salvage_Rare.name: Veiled Crystal

CraftingScrap_EventReward_Leather_01.desc: Scrap items may be salvaged for crafting reagents or sold directly to vendors.
CraftingScrap_EventReward_Leather_01.flavor: The dried pelts of several kinds of local creatures, bound tightly together and ready for salvage.
CraftingScrap_EventReward_Leather_01.name: Bundle of Hides

CraftingScrap_EventReward_Ore_01.desc: Scrap items may be salvaged for crafting materials or sold directly to vendors.
CraftingScrap_EventReward_Ore_01.flavor: This sack is filled with a bounty of of salvageable scrapmetal.
CraftingScrap_EventReward_Ore_01.name: Sack of Scrapmetal

Crafting_Elite_01.desc: Obtained by slaying the strongest monsters in Sanctuary.
Crafting_Elite_01.name: {c_specialcraftingmat}Fragment of Hatred{/c}

Crafting_Magic_01.desc: Obtained by using the Blacksmith to salvage magic weapons and armor.
Crafting_Magic_01.name: Arcane Dust

Crafting_Normal_01.desc: Obtained by using the Blacksmith to salvage normal weapons and armor.
Crafting_Normal_01.name: Scrap

CursedScroll_Chaos.desc:
Teleport to a random location in the zone.

Only works in Fields of Hatred.
CursedScroll_Chaos.name: Cursed Scroll of Chaos

CursedScroll_Hatestalker.desc:
Reveals nearby hostile players and elite monsters on the minimap for 15 seconds, but slows user's movement speed by 15%.

Only works in Fields of Hatred.
CursedScroll_Hatestalker.name: [PH] Cursed Scroll of Hatestalker

CursedScroll_Recklessness.desc:
Increases movement speed by 40% for 15 seconds, but deals 2% of your Maximum Life as bleed damage per second.

Only works in Fields of Hatred.
CursedScroll_Recklessness.name: Cursed Scroll of Recklessness

CursedScroll_Tranquility.desc:
Decreases damage taken from players by 30%, but increases damage taken from monsters by the same amount. Lasts for 20 seconds.

Only works in Fields of Hatred.
CursedScroll_Tranquility.name: Cursed Scroll of Tranquility

DGN_Collect_Mote_01.desc: Collect Animus to empower it's Urn
DGN_Collect_Mote_01.name: Animus

DGN_Frac_CultistRefuge_Key.flavor: A metal key forged with demonic runes.
DGN_Frac_CultistRefuge_Key.name: Cultist Key

DGN_Frac_DefiledCatacomb_Key.flavor: A key obtained from the Gate Keep in Defiled Catacombs.
DGN_Frac_DefiledCatacomb_Key.name: Catacomb Key

DGN_Frac_DerelictLodge_Key.flavor: A key stained with dry blood.
DGN_Frac_DerelictLodge_Key.name: Bloodstained Key

DGN_Frac_ForsakenQuarry_Key.flavor: A key obtained from the Prisoner in the Forsaken Quarry
DGN_Frac_ForsakenQuarry_Key.name: Greasy Key

DGN_Frac_KorValarRamparts_Key.flavor: A metal key branded with Cathedral of Light sigil.
DGN_Frac_KorValarRamparts_Key.name: Branded Key

DGN_Frac_KorValarRamparts_Key_02.flavor: A metal key branded with the Cathedral of Light sigil. Someone has attempted to cover over the Cathedral of Light sigil on the key with an unknown substance. The sigil however is embossed into the key and is still clearly visible.
DGN_Frac_KorValarRamparts_Key_02.name: Stained Key

DGN_Frac_RitualTower_Key.flavor: A key to the Malignant Stratum.
DGN_Frac_RitualTower_Key.name: Adalgrim's Key

DGN_Hawe_BelfryZakara_Key.flavor: A key obtained from the Anchorbound Chaplain.
DGN_Hawe_BelfryZakara_Key.name: Rusted Key

DGN_Hawe_EndlessGates_Key.flavor: A key to an unknown door.
DGN_Hawe_EndlessGates_Key.name: Mage Key

DGN_Hawe_IronHold_Key.flavor: A key to a cell in the Slave Pens. Found near a breach in the Fetid Orifice.
DGN_Hawe_IronHold_Key.name: Jailer's Key

DGN_Hawe_LightsRefuge_Key.flavor: A worn key dropped from Rat Handler Clark.
DGN_Hawe_LightsRefuge_Key.name: Handler's Key

DGN_Hawe_MaugansWorks_Key.flavor: A key obtained from the Executioner.
DGN_Hawe_MaugansWorks_Key.name: Executioner's Key

DGN_Hawe_Oblivion_Key.flavor: A key that provides access to the Ritual Pens.
DGN_Hawe_Oblivion_Key.name: Ritual Pens Key

DGN_Hawe_SteadfastBarracks_Key.flavor: A key obtained from Zorym, The Profane Summoner.
DGN_Hawe_SteadfastBarracks_Key.name: Sanctum Key

DGN_Hawe_Witchwater_Key.flavor: A key to the Slithering Crawl. Chipped and covered with rust, this key has seen a lot of use.
DGN_Hawe_Witchwater_Key.name: Worn Key

DGN_Kehj_Conclave_Key.flavor: The Laboratory is more a place for dark magic than science. Grotesque horrors await any who dare enter.
DGN_Kehj_Conclave_Key.name: Laboratory Key

DGN_Kehj_CrusadersCathedral_Key.flavor: A key that had been hidden away until now.
DGN_Kehj_CrusadersCathedral_Key.name: Pristine Key

DGN_Kehj_HereticsAsylum_Key.flavor: A key to the Maximum Security chamber that is now home to the deserter knights' leaders.
DGN_Kehj_HereticsAsylum_Key.name: Maximum Security Key

DGN_Kehj_PrisonofCaldeum_Key.flavor: Opens the gate to the prison depths.
DGN_Kehj_PrisonofCaldeum_Key.name: Warden's Key

DGN_Kehj_RenegadesRetreat_Key.flavor: A key to the central treasure room.
DGN_Kehj_RenegadesRetreat_Key.name: Treasure Room Key

DGN_Kehj_RenegadesRetreat_Key_2.flavor: A key to the central treasure room.
DGN_Kehj_RenegadesRetreat_Key_2.name: Treasure Room Right Key

DGN_Kehj_SunkenLibrary_Key.flavor: Only the highest ranking librarian was allowed to carry the key.
DGN_Kehj_SunkenLibrary_Key.name: Archive Key

DGN_Kehj_TomboftheSaints_Key.desc: Bound to Tomb of the Saints
DGN_Kehj_TomboftheSaints_Key.flavor: A handcrafted key. It seems to only work with two of them together.
DGN_Kehj_TomboftheSaints_Key.name: Curved Key

DGN_Kehj_YshariSanctum_Tome.flavor: An ancient book containing knowledge of the Yshari and their arcane practices.
DGN_Kehj_YshariSanctum_Tome.name: Tome of Yshari Rituals

DGN_Scos_BrokenBulwark_Key.flavor: Key to the inner areas of the bulwark. It's passed between lieutenants at specific times of day to make it difficult for enemies to find it.
DGN_Scos_BrokenBulwark_Key.name: Keep Key

DGN_Scos_GaranHold_Key.flavor: Garan always kept this key with him, until he was eaten.
DGN_Scos_GaranHold_Key.name: Garan's Key

DGN_Scos_LubansRest_Key.flavor: Once used to keep graverobbers out, now it keeps the dead in.
DGN_Scos_LubansRest_Key.name: Crypt Key

DGN_Scos_Stockades_Key.flavor: A key to a heavy gate. It looks like it hasn't been used for years.
DGN_Scos_Stockades_Key.name: Rusty Metal Key

DGN_Scos_VaultoftheForsaken_Key.desc: Bound to Vault of The Forsaken
DGN_Scos_VaultoftheForsaken_Key.flavor: A key to the Witch's Chamber.
DGN_Scos_VaultoftheForsaken_Key.name: Chamber Key

DGN_Step_CharnelHouse_Key.flavor: A key to the Feeding Pit obtained from Vardo.
DGN_Step_CharnelHouse_Key.name: Feeding Pit Key

DGN_Step_Guulrahn_Jailcells_key.desc: Bound to Sanguine Alley and Jakha Basin
DGN_Step_Guulrahn_Jailcells_key.flavor: An old worn key used to unlock cells in The Dregs. Its covered with dirt and dried blood.
DGN_Step_Guulrahn_Jailcells_key.name: Guulrahn Prison Key

DGN_Step_Orbei_key.flavor: A key to the monk's private living area.
DGN_Step_Orbei_key.name: Simple Key

DGN_Step_PallidDelve_Key.flavor: A salt encrusted key that provides access to the ancient corruption below.
DGN_Step_PallidDelve_Key.name: Salt Encrusted Key

DGN_Step_SealedArchives_Key.flavor: A key to the Archive depths. It's almost completely rotted away.
DGN_Step_SealedArchives_Key.name: Rotten Key

DruidPassive_ReputationItem.desc: Bring Spirit Offerings to the four Druid Spirits in Cerrigar to curry favor and receive powerful boons in return.
DruidPassive_ReputationItem.name: Druidic Spirit Offering

Incense_III_01.flavor: Tier III Incense. Only one Incense per tier may be active at a time.
Incense_III_01.name: The Creatures of Night (WIP)

Incense_II_00.desc: Use: Increases Maximum Life by 500 for every nearby player. Lasts 20 minutes.
Incense_II_00.flavor: Only one Incense may be active at a time.
Incense_II_00.name: Reddamine Buzz

Incense_II_01.desc: Use: Increases all resistances by 10% and armor by 150 for every nearby player. Lasts 20 minutes.
Incense_II_01.flavor: Only one Incense may be active at a time.
Incense_II_01.name: Soothing Spices

Incense_II_02.desc: Use: Increases all stats by 15 for every nearby player. Lasts 20 minutes.
Incense_II_02.flavor: Only one Incense may be active at a time.

Incense_II_03.desc: Use: Increases Thorns by 250 for every nearby player. Lasts 20 minutes.
Incense_II_03.flavor: Only one Incense may be active at a time.
Incense_II_03.name: Scents of the Desert Afternoon

Incense_I_00.desc: Use: Increases Lightning, Cold and Poison Resistances by 12% for every nearby player. Lasts 20 minutes.
Incense_I_00.flavor: Only one Incense may be active at a time.
Incense_I_00.name: Storm of the Wilds

Incense_I_01.desc: Use: Increases Fire and Shadow Resistances by 7.5% and armor by 75 for every nearby player. Lasts 20 minutes.
Incense_I_01.flavor: Only one Incense may be active at a time.
Incense_I_01.name: Desert Escape

Incense_I_02.desc: Use: Increases armor by 200 for every nearby player. Lasts 20 minutes.
Incense_I_02.flavor: Only one Incense may be active at a time.
Incense_I_02.name: Song of the Mountain

Incense_I_03.desc: Use: Increases chance to dodge by 5% for every nearby player. Lasts 20 minutes.
Incense_I_03.flavor: Only one Incense may be active at a time.
Incense_I_03.name: Spirit Dance

Incense_I_04.desc: Use: Increases Strength by 25 for every nearby player. Lasts 20 minutes.
Incense_I_04.flavor: Only one Incense may be active at a time.
Incense_I_04.name: Ancient Times

Incense_I_05.desc: Use: Increases Intelligence by 25 for every nearby player. Lasts 20 minutes.
Incense_I_05.flavor: Only one Incense may be active at a time.
Incense_I_05.name: Sage's Whisper

Incense_I_06.desc: Use: Increases Dexterity by 25 for every nearby player. Lasts 20 minutes.
Incense_I_06.flavor: Only one Incense may be active at a time.
Incense_I_06.name: Queen's Supreme

Incense_I_07.desc: Use: Increases Willpower by 25 for every nearby player. Lasts 20 minutes.
Incense_I_07.flavor: Only one Incense may be active at a time.
Incense_I_07.name: Blessed Guide

Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter03.desc: Contains a legendary chest and boots (Level 40).
Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter03.name: (PH) Eternal Journey Chapter 3 Cache

Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter04.desc: Contains a legendary helmet, amulet, and ring (Level 50).
Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter04.name: (PH) Eternal Journey Chapter 4 Cache

Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter05.desc: Contains a legendary chest, gloves, and boots (Level 50).
Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter05.name: (PH) Eternal Journey Chapter 5 Cache

Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter06.desc: Contains Sacred legendary pants and amulet (Level 60).
Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter06.name: (PH) Eternal Journey Chapter 6 Cache

Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter07.desc: Contains Sacred legendary helm and ring (Level 65).
Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter07.name: (PH) Eternal Journey Chapter 7 Cache

Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter08.desc: Contains Sacred legendary pants, gloves, and boots (Level 70).
Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter08.name: (PH) Eternal Journey Chapter 8 Cache

Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter09.desc: Contains Ancestral legendary helm and chest (Level 80).
Journey_Eternal_Cache_Chapter09.name: (PH) Eternal Journey Chapter 9 Cache

Journey_Seasonal_Chapter1_RewardCache.desc: Contains a Dagger, Off-Hand and 500 Gold
Journey_Seasonal_Chapter1_RewardCache.name: Chapter 1 Reward Cache

Journey_Seasonal_Chapter2_RewardCache.desc: Contains a Helm, Chest, Boots, Herbs and 1000 Gold.
Journey_Seasonal_Chapter2_RewardCache.name: Chapter 2 Reward Cache

Kehj_Conv_Letter.flavor: A sealed letter from Lorath to Donan
Kehj_Conv_Letter.name: Letter to Donan

Lorebook_Item_AmmuitOrders_01.flavor: [PH] In the depths of this tomb resides the sins of their tribe. By order of the Ammuit, for suspicion of demonic summoning, cannibalism, and acts against humanity, these archives shall serve as both prison and grave for the king and his followers. May they feast now only upon themselves and may the lands above forgive us for their crimes.
Lorebook_Item_AmmuitOrders_01.name: [PH] Ammuit Orders

Lorebook_Item_DS1.flavor: A guard petitions her captain to join the fight to save their capital city.
Lorebook_Item_DS1.name: Formal Request

Lorebook_Item_DS2.desc: A hastily scribbled note on tattered parchment
Lorebook_Item_DS2.flavor: [PH] I knew not what I'd gotten myself into. The coin he offered was good. Too good; I should have seen it coming. All was quiet when I first entered this tomb, until the dead rose. I am trapped. I fear I will be one of them soon enough... Whatever curse haunts this damned place, I pray to any god listening that it finds him as well.
Lorebook_Item_DS2.name: Adventurer's Scribbles

Lorebook_Item_DS3.desc: PH Found on a Monk's remains
Lorebook_Item_DS3.flavor: [PH] I've made it to the ancient church. I was surprised to find cultists there, excavating the ruins. They turned me away and threatened me. I fear what they may be looking for - I intend to return tomorrow, and sneak inside to see what they are doing there.
Lorebook_Item_DS3.name: [PH] Bloody Diary

Lorebook_Item_DS4.flavor: [PH] The stench carried by the northern winds grows stronger, day by day... The smell has driven my brother mad, his ravings of what he saw in that accursed chapel are endless. Those unable to bear it any longer have taken daggers to their noses, hollowing their visage. This must be the only way to end the suffering...
Lorebook_Item_DS4.name: [ph] Bloodied Journal

Lorebook_Item_DS5.flavor: [PH] The alchemist's incense used to mask the stench of human rot had no effect. Now that potion twiddling bastard has asked for a sample of whatever vile flesh lurks within the chapel. Tonight, while the savages sleep I will get him what he needs.
Lorebook_Item_DS5.name: [ph] Ravaged Journal

Lorebook_Item_DS6.desc: An old tome full of carefully taken notes
Lorebook_Item_DS6.flavor: [PH] The miners found the idol in a crumbling ruin in the depths of the salt mine. I instructed them to tell no-one. Shortly after, the whispers began. It was an alluring voice. It reassured me that I should not fear the Tyrant of Guulrahn. It told me that it would give us the power to protect ourselves from their savage onslaught... I don't know what other choice I have. How else are we to survive this?
Lorebook_Item_DS6.name: Elder Haerastus' Journal

Lorebook_Item_DonanJournal_01.flavor: [PH] When they sing of heroes, they never sing of what comes after.  The responsibility of living up to your own legend.  Years of peoples' expectations and desires weighing you down.  Vanquishing a demon does not make one a leader.  But I am trying.
Lorebook_Item_DonanJournal_01.name: [PH] Donan's Burden

Lorebook_Item_DruidsPrayer_01.desc: PH A note for those still new to these more desperate practices
Lorebook_Item_DruidsPrayer_01.flavor: [PH]Ancestors, through beast's eyes we ask you observe us. May the blood of our blessing reach each root and give our crops strength to provide. And may our soul serve to protect these stones until our blessing is answered. We offer you our lives. So it shall be.
Lorebook_Item_DruidsPrayer_01.name: [PH] Druid's Prayer

Lorebook_Item_FP1.flavor: Our work in the tower is done, just as she showed us. A fine tribute. We will send more as we find them. Maybe that old man up on the ridge. We offered her the monk. She shared her gift with him, but he is stubborn. He will see the truth soon enough.
Lorebook_Item_FP1.name: Vani's Journal

Lorebook_Item_FP2.flavor: Short fangs. Young. Freshly turned. An easy kill. Further south than the others. They are spreading.
Lorebook_Item_FP2.name: Specimen Notes

Lorebook_Item_FP3.flavor: More knights funnel in by the hour. We have made camp before the great gate. To think the Prophet was able to cast it open with a mere wave of his hand... He is truly blessed. With the gate open, we no longer need that wretched passage below. I've sealed it with a simple cantrip. The keyword is "Floodway."
Lorebook_Item_FP3.name: Scholar's Notes - Floodway

Lorebook_Item_FP4.flavor: PH - Notes about the ruins and the first civilization.
Lorebook_Item_FP4.name: Scholar's Notes - PH02

Lorebook_Item_FP5.flavor: PH - Notes about the ruins and the first civilization.
Lorebook_Item_FP5.name: Scholar's Notes - PH03

Lorebook_Item_FP6.flavor: You are hereby tasked with this solemn and holy duty: Travel to the town of Nevesk and search the crumbling tower for signs of evil or the taint of the demonic. Purge any creature that hides in the shadows of that place.
Lorebook_Item_FP6.name: Monk's Orders

Lorebook_Item_Guulrahn_Prison.flavor: A Guulrahni villager's journal recounting the recent cannibal invasion.
Lorebook_Item_Guulrahn_Prison.name: Dropped Journal

Lorebook_Item_H1.flavor: The Snakes of Hawezar. Forever changing. Never stagnant. They are strong where we are frail. The witch Zala, who lived on the edge of the town called it "foolishness". Fear, just another weakness to cast aside.
Lorebook_Item_H1.name: The Scaled Tomes: Book I

Lorebook_Item_H2.flavor: We struck heavy bargains, and learned deep secrets. We called out through the marshes and swamps, and the snakes came to us. Many were consumed by the snakes, and will be given everlasting life! A miracle to behold.
Lorebook_Item_H2.name: Cultist Writings

Lorebook_Item_H3.flavor: Mohlon, our queen, took Zala's ritual pools from her. Claimed them as her own, as she should by rights. From those caverns did she come to us, and there she rules, protected.
Lorebook_Item_H3.name: Cultist Writings

Lorebook_Item_H4.flavor: I am convinced that this temple belonged to the Necromancers, or Priests of Rathma. However, it predates their existence by centuries. I suspect this was once a place of study for Rathma himself.
Lorebook_Item_H4.name: Elias' Research Notes, Part 1

Lorebook_Item_H5.flavor: I've discovered that this place was used to test potential leaders of the Necromancer's order. After being selected as the next Deathspeaker, they would travel here to undergo rites and rituals designed to prove their worthiness. The weak perished, and lay here forgotten.
Lorebook_Item_H5.name: Elias' Research Notes, Part 2

Lorebook_Item_H6.flavor: My search has finally born fruit. Long ago, Rathma spent decades here researching the cycle of life and death. Hidden among his works include forbidden rituals to disrupt that balance. The secret to unending life hides here, I am sure of it!
Lorebook_Item_H6.name: Elias' Research Notes, Part 3

Lorebook_Item_H7.flavor: Finally! After many weeks of poring through crumbling manuscripts, I have unlocked the secret! It is not a single ritual that will grant me everlasting life, but the combination of three! Soon, there will be no force upon Sanctuary that can stop me.
Lorebook_Item_H7.name: Elias' Research Notes, Part 4

Lorebook_Item_H9.flavor: A water stained collection of loose papers.
Lorebook_Item_H9.name: Villager's Journal

Lorebook_Item_HoradricVaultJournal_01.flavor: (PH) This gives you one of the runewords you need to ender Elias's study.
Lorebook_Item_HoradricVaultJournal_01.name: (PH) Elias's Journal

Lorebook_Item_IssaliaJournal_01.flavor: [PH]The council didn't listen. Now the ritual is befouled and the stench of hell grows strong beyond the portal's veil. The altars must be brought down before the corruption spreads.
Lorebook_Item_IssaliaJournal_01.name: [PH] Issalia's Journal, Entry 1

Lorebook_Item_IssaliaJournal_02.flavor: [PH] The minions of hell are here. The altars are corrupted. My way back is blocked. My only hope now is to circle back around and wait for my daughters at the archives. There we can confront the evil together.
Lorebook_Item_IssaliaJournal_02.name: [PH] Issalia's Journal, Entry 2

Lorebook_Item_IssaliaJournal_03.flavor: [PH] There is something already here and I no longer sense the presence of my daughters. I can wait no longer. I must face this alone.
Lorebook_Item_IssaliaJournal_03.name: [PH] Issalia's Journal, Entry 3

Lorebook_Item_KeironsPyre.desc: A few scraps of parchment, charred around the edges
Lorebook_Item_KeironsPyre.name: Eriman's Plea

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_01.desc: Written by the abbot of the Orbei Monastery, in a thin hand.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_01.flavor: Lo, the Great Beast Tathamet was struck down and its blackened husk sank below the abyss. There, it smoldered and festered, and from the ruin of its Seven Heads were born Seven Great Evils. Three Primes and Four Lessers. Enemies of all creation.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_01.name: The Birth of Hell

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_02.desc: Written by the abbot of the Orbei Monastery, in a thin hand.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_02.flavor: Throughout my time here, one thing has been a constant. The knowledge enters, it does not leave. We are bound by the vows for the rest of lives, a commitment none of us take lightly. But now, this man at our door says the knowledge we hold may save the world. My scholars look to me to guide them. They will be bound to the decision I make. It is a heavy burden.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_02.name: (PH) Abbot of Orbei Journal Entry 2

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_03.desc: Written by the abbot of the Orbei Monastery, in a thin hand.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_03.flavor: To Monk Miatin. Please ensure this memo gets out to all monks of the Monastery. All tomes related to demon summoning, the old culture's blood magic rituals, and any recent reports of the increase in demon sightings should be brought to the inner cloister for storage.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_03.name: (A note from the Abbot of Orbei to another Monk.

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_04.desc: Written by the abbot of the Orbei Monastery, in a thin hand.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_04.flavor: I have sent messages to my old friend Lorath. The Horadrim that remains with us claims to not have met him, which is hardly surprising. Lorath was never social with his brethren, even in the best of times. He preferred walking with the people of Sanctuary to studying tomes and dusty parchment. Still, I hope he gets word back quickly, I'm reaching a decision, but I would value his judgement.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_04.name: (PH) Abbot of Orbei Journal Entry 4

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_05.desc: Written by the abbot of the Orbei Monastery, in a thin hand.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_05.flavor: Something has changed in Orbei. I feel a madness in the air. No, madness is incorrect. An anguish, unholy. All consuming. What I'd give to lie here and-- (The rest of this entry has been scratched out and smeared with blood)
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_05.name: (PH) Abbot of Orbei Journal Entry 5

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote.desc: Written by a monk of the Orbei Monastery, in a thin hand.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote.flavor: I suppose it is ironic that for so many decades we've been kept safe by our relative seclusion from the rest of Sanctuary. Now it will be our downfall. I can hear my fellow monks screaming beyond the doors.  Monk Miatin is rallying those of us that are left; we cannot allow the knowledge to leave. What else can I do? I will fight.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote.name: Blood-Soaked Handwritten Missive

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote2.desc: Written by the Abbot of Orbei Monastery, in a steady, practiced hand.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote2.flavor: Commissioned during the Time of Troubles, the Orbei Archive once served to codify heresies for the Inquisition. Since then, the Archive has expanded to the study of all evils, restricted to only the most devout Scholars of Zakarum.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote2.name: The Orbei Monastery, Part 1

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote3.desc: Written by the Abbot of Orbei Monastery, in a steady, practiced hand.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote3.flavor: Critics rightly fear the dangers of our scholarship, but ignorance of evil offers little protection from it. Our insights have proven invaluable to Paladins, Horadrim, and Angels alike in the fight against the darkness.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote3.name: The Orbei Monastery, Part 2

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote4.desc: Written by a monk of the Orbei Monastery, in an excited scribble.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote4.flavor: PH: A list of new recruits the monk is to train. A small note on how excited she is to see the scholarly arts are not fading.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote4.name: A large folded piece of parchement

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote4b.desc: Written by a monk of the Orbei Monastery, in an hasty scribble.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote4b.flavor: (PH) "Something isn't right, the Abbot has allowed the stranger into the Inner Cloister. He told him the words of our founders! I heard him! Take this note to Monk Lahya and..." The note ends with a scrawl and bloodstains.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote4b.name: A small piece of scribbled parchment

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote5.desc: Written by a monk of the Orbei Monastery in a practiced, steady hand.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote5.flavor: (PH) Monk Sashtchen, the Abbot has me transcribing the history of the known demons worshipped by the ancient people of the Dry Steppes. BEFORE the Zakarum colonization. I think he wants to know if the religion was more of a passive ideation of beings of power as a form of protection or if there were specific evils they sought to emulate. Eitehr way, no, I cannot help you with your own tomes, ask Monk Miatin.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote5.name: A small piece of carefully folded parchment

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote6.desc: Written by a monk of the Orbei Monastery in a practiced, steady hand.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote6.flavor: (PH) More information on the history of the Monastery, specifically it's rules about secrecy and silence on any knowledge learned from the tomes it holds within.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote6.name: A large, well bound tome

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote7.desc: Written by a monk of the Orbei Monastery in a thin, hasty hand.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote7.flavor: (PH) The personal journal of a low level monk.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote7.name: A personal journal

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote_LogBook.desc: A log book of all visitors to the Monastery. There are very few names on the pages.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote_LogBook.flavor: Brother Horardim Elias, Year 1338. Traveling Scholar Kamien  (refused entry), Year  1337. Traveling Merchant Joren (refused entry), Year 1325. Brothers Horadrim Lorath and Elias, Year 1024.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote_LogBook.name: A Visitor Log Book

Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_01.desc: Part of a history of the Horadrim
Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_01.flavor: In the ancient days when the first Horadrim walked in Sanctuary, there were many who would do them harm. A great Vault was constructed as a place of study, and of safekeeping for the dangerous artifacts they collected. The entrance of this Vault was hidden with powerful enchantments, so that any who attempted to seek it without pure motive would be led astray and become lost.
Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_01.name: (PH) Chronicles of the Horadrim, Part One

Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_02.desc: Part of a history of the Horadrim
Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_02.flavor: After the defeat of the Prime Evils, the Horadrim cast about for work to put their hands to. Some say the members of  the order retired, fading into obscurity and departing the mortal world. Others claim that the cache of evil artifacts they possessed was too great a temptation for the weaker-willed among them, and some Horadrim became powerful necromancers, retreating into the dark corners of Sanctuary to practice their forbidden rites and bide their time.
Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_02.name: (PH) Chronicles of the Horadrim, Part Two

Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_03.desc: Part of a history of the Horadrim
Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_03.flavor: The fate of the Horadrim has always been entwined with that of the Archangels. After all, it was Tyrael himself who revived the order after its long dormancy. However, not all the Archangels are equally supportive of the Horadrim's activities. Some of the more reclusive ones appear to view the Horadrim with suspicion and distrust, but have not interfered, perhaps seeing them as a distasteful but necessary bulwark against the Prime Evils.
Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_03.name: (PH) Chronicles of the Horadrim, Part Three

Lorebook_Item_QST_EliasPalace_Elias_01.flavor: A tome written by Elias, describing the teachings and wisdom of Lilith.
Lorebook_Item_QST_EliasPalace_Elias_01.name: Gospel of the Mother

Lorebook_Item_QST_EliasPalace_Elias_02.flavor: A tome written by Elias, describing the teachings and wisdom of Lilith.
Lorebook_Item_QST_EliasPalace_Elias_02.name: Gospel of the Mother

Lorebook_Item_QST_EliasPalace_Elias_03.flavor: A tome written by Elias, describing the teachings and wisdom of Lilith.
Lorebook_Item_QST_EliasPalace_Elias_03.name: Gospel of the Mother

Lorebook_Item_QaraYisu_01.desc: Written by a watcher of Qara-Yisu
Lorebook_Item_QaraYisu_01.flavor: The cannibals took twelve more of us this week, but Elder Davan has finally gone to the mines. He will free the Ancient Spirit and we will claim its power. No one will threaten Qara Yisu again.
Lorebook_Item_QaraYisu_01.name: Watchman's Log

Lorebook_Item_QaraYisu_02.desc: Written by a miner of Qara-Yisu
Lorebook_Item_QaraYisu_02.flavor: A voice in the mines has answered our prayers! "Free me from the salt," it said, "and I shall raise three spires. Then, my power shall be yours."
Lorebook_Item_QaraYisu_02.name: Miner's Journal

Lorebook_Item_RefugeesKillerContract.desc: Written in scratchy handwriting, still damp with blood.
Lorebook_Item_RefugeesKillerContract.flavor:
Taymiyyah. Your debt is paid. Be free, my little bird.

--Ihsan
Lorebook_Item_RefugeesKillerContract.name: Scrawled Note

Lorebook_Item_RussellLand_treasureGoblin.flavor: [PH]The pages are infinite. Each page you turn gets you no closer to the end and yet no page is the same. Gibberish mostly, but I'd assume somewhere within it's endless pages is everything.
Lorebook_Item_RussellLand_treasureGoblin.name: [PH] The Complete Knowledge of the Universe

Lorebook_Item_SC1.desc: An edict delivered by the Knights' Penitent
Lorebook_Item_SC1.name: Cathedral Edict

Lorebook_Item_SwarmersNote_01.desc: Written by Scosglen's last swarmer druid. Still covered in webbing and honeycomb.
Lorebook_Item_SwarmersNote_01.flavor: [PH]I suppose this is how my story ends. I was a keeper. One of the few shepherds and protectors for the insects. Some folks called us swarmers on account of us often being seen relocating colonies. With the recent disappearances of the other keepers, my responsibilities grew. I spose the burden was more than anyone could handle. I woke up today to find myself encrusted to my bed with egg layers burrowing into my flesh. Seems I've been elected Queen. Can't seem to dig my way out. My only hope is some other pest takes over the hive and ends my reign. Problem is, they all seem much calmer around me.
Lorebook_Item_SwarmersNote_01.name: [PH] Swarmer's Note

Lorebook_Item_Template.flavor: [PH]This is a placeholder Lorebook entry. This conversation should be duplicated and used to populate other lorebooks.
